thread.title: Van Gaal hints at his Man United starting XI vs CSKA Moscow
thread.title_full: Van Gaal hints at his Man United starting XI vs CSKA Moscow

author: paulmbanks
title: Van Gaal hints at his Man United starting XI vs CSKA Moscow
text:
Tweet 
Louis van Gaal has indicated that he won’t change much from Sunday when he selects the Manchester United first team to take on CSKA Moscow in the UEFA Champions League Group stages Wednesday night. Given what a dominating performance the Red Devils turned in at Everton, why should he make a lot of changes? 
If it ain’t broke, don’t fix it, right? 
Here is the Man United starting XI from Sunday: Starting XIEverton vs Manchester United #GGMU #MUFC Semoga tiga poin buat malam ini?.Amiii ?? pic.twitter.com/E6oYOlMxXy 
— Indomanutd Pekanbaru (@Indomanutd_pku) October 17, 2015 
Van Gaal said today : “I am not stupid. I won’t change too much on Wednesday.” 
The Dutchman dropped Memphis Depay and promoted Ander Herrera, who responded by putting in a man of the match worthy performance. Van Gaal seems to be saying that he won’t be resting any starters on Wednesday in lieu of the Manchester Derby. Therefore, you should expect to see a lineup quite similar to this. 
For what it’s worth, The Sports Bank’s Man United starting XI prediction will be posted by very early morning. No doubt, we’ll take into account the comments Van Gaal made today. 
As always, feel free to post what you think the Man United starting XI should be in the comments section below. 
Paul M. Banks owns, operates and sometimes writes The Sports Bank.net , which is partnered with FOX Sports Engage Network. The website is also featured on News Now. 
Banks, a former writer for the Washington Times, currently contributes to the Chicago Tribune RedEye. He also appears regularly on numerous talk shows all across the country. Catch him Tuesdays on KOZN 1620 The Zone.
